H0.text: who developed the concept of total quality management. Joseph Juran

H1.text: who developed the concept of total quality management. Armand V. Feigenbaum

H2.text: who developed the concept of total quality management. Kaoru Ishikawa

H3.text: who developed the concept of total quality management. W. Edwards Deming

A4.text: It is almost certainly inspired by Armand V. Feigenbaum's multi-edition book Total Quality Control (OCLC 299383303) and Kaoru Ishikawa's What Is Total Quality Control? The Japanese Way (OCLC 11467749).

A5.text: The Navy branded the effort 'Total Quality Management' in 1985.

A6.text: Deming offered 14 key principles to managers for transforming business effectiveness.

A7.text: Deming was the father of the quality movement.
